title: Erigon stuck on "Processing bodies..."
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: erigon/v2.49.2-stable-a8ae8a03/linux-amd64/go1.20.8

OS & Version: Linux Debian

Erigon Command (with flags/config): unclear, via eth-docker

Concensus Layer: Lighthouse

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config): unclear, via eth-docker

Chain/Network: Mainnet

#### Expected behaviour

Chain syncs and works

#### Actual behaviour

The chain is stuck on processing bodies and does not finish.

```
eth-docker-execution-1  | [INFO] [09-26|08:00:56.570] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth68=33 eth67=33
eth-docker-execution-1  | [INFO] [09-26|08:00:56.933] [txpool] stat                            pending=5627 baseFee=30000 queued=30000 alloc=4.4GB sys=6.2GB

eth-docker-execution-1  | [INFO] [09-26|08:01:03.915] [EngineBlockDownloader] Downloading block bodies block_num=18217239 delivery/sec=1.6MB wasted/sec=0B remaining=782 delivered=5668 cache=54.5MB alloc=4.5GB sys=6.2GB

eth-docker-execution-1  | [INFO] [09-26|08:04:00.431] [NewPayload] Handling new payload        height=18218048 hash=0x3327c0ad518f4a9e788dc876a3f5107676e478cc3615d89be12cf254cd084d00
eth-docker-execution-1  | [INFO] [09-26|08:04:12.143] [NewPayload] Handling new payload        height=18218049 hash=0x807928d0cb95fc4b6b9a88734b63024cd02bbb08e66ed18be466052d8dcacb45
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I needed to move to a bigger SSD. So I stopped all my clients (via eth-docker), copied all data to a new SSD and restarted the clients.

I have the same issue with two different nodes. I''ve tried to update erigon up to 2.50.0, but it doesn't help.
log from first node:
```
erigon_1  | [INFO] [09-28|21:26:36.495] [NewPayload] Handling new payload        height=18236905 hash=0xfe245b9d574138fa83b4593502442b24062267b62ee1a6c657c5e7cace46b16e
```

**System information** 
Erigon version: erigon/v2.49.2-stable-a8ae8a03/linux-amd64/go1.20.8

OS & Version: Linux Ubuntu

Erigon Command (with flags/config): 
```
erigon --chain=mainnet --datadir=/home/erigon/.local/share/erigon --port=30303 --http.vhosts=* --http.addr=0.0.0.0 --http.port=8545 --authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0 --authrpc.port=8551 --torrent.port=42069 --private.api.addr=0.0.0.0:9090 --http --ws --http.api=eth,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon --authrpc.jwtsecret=/tmp/jwtsecret
```

Concensus Layer: Lighthouse/v4.5.0

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config): 
```
 lighthouse --network mainnet beacon --debug-level info --datadir /root/.lighthouse --eth1 --http --http-allow-sync-stalled --execution-endpoints http://127.0.0.1:8551 --enr-udp-port=9000 --enr-tcp-port=9000 --discovery-port=9000 --jwt-secrets="/tmp/jwtsecret" --checkpoint-sync-url="https://beaconstate.ethstaker.cc" --purge-db
```

Chain/Network: Mainnet

Running Erigon 2.49.2 from docker hub (erigon:stable), with current Lighthouse as consensus client.

same issue as well

tried restart, no success
